subject: Relationships
title: The Soft Startup
description: A micro-lesson that makes The Soft Startup usable.

hook.text: The first three minutes of an argument predict its outcome. Start harsh, and 96% of the time it ends badly.

buildup.text: A 'soft startup' means raising a complaint without blame: 'I feel X when Y' instead of 'You always Z.'

discovery.text: Gottman found that women initiate 80% of relationship discussions. How they start determines everything.

twist.text: Soft startups feel unnatural when you're angry. But anger expressed gently is heard; anger screamed is blocked.

climax.text: The hardest relationship skill: saying something painful in a way that your partner can actually hear it.

punchline.text: How you start the fight determines how it ends.

quiz.question: What predicts the outcome of a relationship argument?
options: The first three minutes of the conversation
